definition: to visit/to call on/to seek/to inquire/to investigate
beautiful/very satisfactory/good/to beautify/to be pleased with oneself
the Americas/abbr. for 美洲[Mei3 zhou1]/USA/abbr. for 美國|美国[Mei3 guo2]

sentences.english: The visit of President Hu Jintao to the United States will create an important opportunity for China-US cooperation.
sentences.chinese: 胡錦濤主席訪美，將開啓中美合作的又一個重要機遇。

sentences.english: Mr. Mubarak's visit to the Oval Office marks an improvement in U.S.-Egyptian relations.
sentences.chinese: 穆巴拉克的訪美標誌着美國和埃及關係的改善。

sentences.english: This week's visit is Hu's first to the United States since becoming president in 2003.
sentences.chinese: 本週的訪問是胡2003年成爲主席後第一次訪美。

sentences.english: Second, why is China so opposed to Lee Teng-hui visit the United States?
sentences.chinese: 第二個問題是，中國爲何如此反對李登輝訪美？

sentences.english: During the visit he promised to push Sinn Fein to make concrete positive decisions.
sentences.chinese: 訪美期間，他許諾將促進新芬黨採取具體的積極步驟。

sentences.english: According to reports, during his visit before the original will also meet with U.
sentences.chinese: 據報道，訪美期間前原還將與美國政府高官舉行會晤。

definition: Xi Jinping (1953-), PRC politician, General Secretary of the CCP from 2012, president of the PRC from 2013
to swear the oath of office
to go and visit in an official capacity or for investigation
Marshall (name)/George Catlett Marshall (1880-1959), US general in WWII and Secretary of State 1947-1949, author of the postwar Marshall plan for Europe and Nobel peace laureate
UNESCO, United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization
Abe Shinzo (1954-), Japanese LDP politician, prime minister 2006-2007 and from 2012
